channel.title: This error is freaking murdering me!
channel.description:
Is there any way I can get rid of this error without removing my code that I added? I recently added castlewars to my server but it keeps telling me the code is too long, what should I do?
[code]client.java:17771: code too large public void parseIncomingPackets() { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: This error is freaking murdering me!
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

public void extraObjectCalls(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY)
{
     if(objectID == x)
     {
          /*blablabla*/
     }
     if(objectID == x && objectX == y)
     {
          /*blablabla*/
     }
}

And inside that case (packet), call extraObjectCalls(objectID, objectX, objectY);.

Read full topic
item.source: This error is freaking murdering me!

item.title: This error is freaking murdering me!
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

What if it isn’t a case? This is part of the code:

[code]if (objectID == 4470 && (objectX == 2377) && (objectY == 3131))
// Zamorak Energy barrier 1
{
if(playerIsSaradomin == true) //Checks if player is in the Saradomin Team
{
sendMessage(“You are not allowed into the enemy’s area!”);
} else {

if (absX == 2376) {
teleportToX = 2377;
teleportToY = 3131;
}
if (absX == 2377) {
teleportToX = 2376;
teleportToY = 3131;
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: This error is freaking murdering me!

item.title: This error is freaking murdering me!
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“zubmage, post:6, topic:191749”][quote author=Stanyer link=topic=255411.msg2127620#msg2127620 date=1206220806]

Dude every compiler error gives a description

client.java:17771: “code too large”

You just don’t know how to understand it, or how to do on your own.

And you can understand it?
No, didn’t think so.
[/quote]

Roy baby, you had trouble earlier today making global objects -.-

Tyvm Stanyer, so I just have to cut it into smaller pieces? :-)[/quote]

Yup, instead of say

case 73:
Amg lots of code here
break;

You should take it out and seperate it into sub methods such as

public void amgLotsOfStuff()
{
//Stuff here
}

Then in case 73, just put amgLotsOfStuff(), just an example anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: This error is freaking murdering me!
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

The code inside parseIncomingPackets() is too large.

Each method, variable etc can only contain 64k of data.

What you should do, is take out some of the programming from within that method, and seperate them into other methods, then call them where the code you put into another method should be.

Read full topic
